Step 1 of 3

Let’s get you a wallet to invest

The simplest way to access PeakDeFi is to create a wallet with Argent wallet. Learn why in our FAQ.

Download the app

I have already a wallet

PeakDeFi exists on the Ethereum blockchain, which uses similar technology to Bitcoin to guarantee that you own and control your assets. To interact with the Ethereum blockchain, you need a wallet like Argent.

Transactions related to your PeakDeFi operations on Ethereum cost “gas”, which are micro amounts of Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency (Ether).

Step 1 of 3
Done
Step 2 of 3

Buy crypto

Investing on PeakDeFi requires ETH (Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency) or ERC20 tokens. You can buy ETH or the supported ERC20 tokens with your credit card via Wyre and Argent. Then, you are ready to invest on PeakDeFi.

Buy via Wyre

Buy via Argent

Back
Step 2 of 3
Done
Step 3 of 3

Connect Argent to PeakDeFi

1

Open Peakdefi.com on your laptop and look for the option to connect a wallet.

2

Select WalletConnect among the connect options. You will be presented with a QR code.

3

Open your Argent app and tap Scan on your Assets screen at the top.

4

Scan the QR code. You will be prompted to authorize the Dapp in your Argent wallet.

Back
Step 3 of 3
Invest

Frequently Asked Questions

What does blockchain technology mean?

PeakDeFi exists on the Ethereum blockchain, which uses similar technology to Bitcoin to guarantee that you own and control your assets. To interact with the Ethereum blockchain, you need a wallet like Argent.

Why the Ethereum blockchain?

Ethereum is a general-purpose blockchain with smart contracts that enable programmable tokens, like PeakDeFi funds shares, which represents your assets under management in PeakDeFi.

How is this built?

On Ethereum, PeakDeFi is run by a suite of smart contracts that manage your balances and assets.

PeakDeFi smart contracts are audited and secured by different audit partners.

What is gas?

Transactions related to your PeakDeFi operations on Ethereum cost “gas”, which are micro amounts of Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency (Ether).

Need more help?

The Ethereum blockchain

PeakDeFi exists on the Ethereum blockchain, which uses similar technology to Bitcoin to guarantee that you own and control your assets. To interact with the Ethereum blockchain, you need a wallet like Argent.

Transactions related to your PeakDeFi operations on Ethereum cost “gas”, which are micro amounts of Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency (Ether).

Let’s get you a wallet to stake

The simplest way to earn staking rewards on PeakDeFi is to create a wallet with Argent wallet. Learn why in our FAQ.

Download the app

I have already a wallet

PeakDeFi exists on the Ethereum blockchain, which uses similar technology to Bitcoin to guarantee that you own and control your assets. To interact with the Ethereum blockchain, you need a wallet like Argent.

Transactions related to your PeakDeFi operations on Ethereum cost “gas”, which are micro amounts of Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency (Ether).

Done
Step 2 of 5

Buy crypto

Earning staking reward on PeakDeFi requires ETH (Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency). You can buy ETH with your credit card via Wyre or Argent. Then, you are ready to stake.

Buy via Wyre

Buy via Argent

Step 3 of 5

Connect Argent to PeakDeFi

1

Open Peakdefi.com on your laptop and look for the option to connect a wallet.

2

Select WalletConnect among the connect options. You will be presented with a QR code.

3

Open your Argent app and tap Scan on your Assets screen at the top.

4

Scan the QR code. You will be prompted to authorize the Dapp in your Argent wallet.

Back
Step 3 of 5
Done
Step 4 of 5

Staking your PEAK to earn rewards

Peak holders stake PEAK in return for rewards from the system’s inflationary monetary policy and the referral program.

1

If you have staked your PEAK, you are eligible to collect two kinds of rewards: staking rewards, and referral rewards generated via the PeakDeFi ecosystem.

2

Frequently Asked Questions

What does blockchain technology mean?

PeakDeFi exists on the Ethereum blockchain, which uses similar technology to Bitcoin to guarantee that you own and control your assets. To interact with the Ethereum blockchain, you need a wallet like Argent.

Why the Ethereum blockchain?

Ethereum is a general-purpose blockchain with smart contracts that enable programmable tokens, like PeakDeFi funds shares, which represents your assets under management in PeakDeFi.

How is this built?

On Ethereum, PeakDeFi is run by a suite of smart contracts that manage your balances and assets.

PeakDeFi smart contracts are audited and secured by different audit partners.

What is gas?

Transactions related to your PeakDeFi operations on Ethereum cost “gas”, which are micro amounts of Ethereum’s native cryptocurrency (Ether).

Team

Team

Raphael Sirtoli

Co-founder

Raphael Sirtoli has an MSc in Molecular Biology and is a PhD candidate in Neuroscience at the Behavioral n’ Molecular Lab in Portugal. His understanding of metabolism, nutrition and clinical medicine is the base from which Nutrita’s knowledge derives. He loves open scientific debate, Crossfit, football, hiking and cold water immersion.

Edouard Soutzo

Co-founder

Edouard is an entrepreneur with a background in wealth management. He worked on several startups and co-founded a fintech & a networking app. He is an avid learner and an autodidact who loves chess, eating keto and rowing on a lake.

Guillaume Palayer

Design & frontend

In charge of everything related to design and frontend code. He spent the last 8 years building, designing, and marketing web-based products. He is a self-taught developer and UX designer. He studied linguistics and marketing before opting out to focus on foodtech and crypto-economics through Nutrita and Betoken, a crowd-sourced crypto assets management protocol he co-founded.

Tomasz Rojek

CTO

Tomasz is a lead developer in major IT companies with more than 10 years of programming experience as a lead developer and has a strong biochemistry background. He’s active in the community of entrepreneurs and participated in many hackathons as well as startup boot camps.

Sarah Neidler

Nutrition & Research

Sarah did her PhD in cancer research at the Beatson Institute for Cancer Research in Glasgow. She has a strong interest in nutrition and the ketogenic diet and believes that they are beneficial for the treatment and prevention of chronic conditions, such as heart disease and diabetes. She loves cooking, reading, sewing, Yoga, and CrossFit.

Andrea Barrett

Content Editor

Andrea is a writer specializing in health and wellness. She holds a Bachelor of Arts in Communication Studies from McMaster University, is a certified personal trainer with the National Academy of Sports Medicine (NASM), and is currently studying to become a certified nutritional practitioner (CNP) with the Institute of Holistic Nutrition.

What we believe in, what we stand for, and why we’re building Nutrita

What we believe in, what we stand for, and why we’re building Nutrita

We want to get the science right and do good by our audience and users.

To do that, we write about topics that interest our audience and that our team have studied deeply. Accurate, actionable and interesting is what we aim for.

Our content team includes Ph.D. research scientists, copy editors, graphic designers and engineers, all lending their professional expertise to produce great content. We’re careful to reference key claims with numbers [1] linking to a particular scientific study for anyone to verify independently.

When producing content, our team judiciously considers clinical evidence, animal models, observational data, computational models, clinical case-reports and considerations stemming evolutionary biology.

Expert Advisors

Expert Advisors

Our expert advisory board includes doctors, engineers and researchers who provide viewpoint diversity and lend their expertise to our mission.

Dominic D'Agostino

PhD

Dominic is a tenured Associate Professor at the USF Morsani College of Medicine and a research scientist at IHMC. He seeks to educate scientists, clinicians and the lay public on metabolic-based research to advance the treatment and prevention of disease. He’s a talented and tireless public advocate of good science.

Eric Sodicoff

MD

Eric completed his undergraduate studies from from Temple University’s School of Medicine in 1996 and finished his internal medicine residency in 1999. He’s a primary care physician board certified in internal and obesity medicine. His special interest is in low-carb/ketogenic diets with an emphasis on root cause analyses.

Jacqui van Kemenade

MD

Jacqui is a general medical practitioner (GP) since 2002 and co-owns a private practice. She’s a consultant GP specializing in diabetes who performs root cause analyses for her patients chronic health conditions. She’s a passionate science communicator who focuses on the relationship between nutrition and chronic disease.

Tucker Goodrich

CTO

Tucker is an IT engineer and autodidact who has successfully applied himself to the field of nutrition. He has considerable expertise on the health effects of high omega-6 seed oils, their role in ‘diseases of civilization’ and knows how to best integrate considerations from evolutionary biology into nutrition and medicine.

Antonio Martinez

Nutrition & Research

Antonio is a lawyer, experienced lobbyist, a co-founder of Public Health Collaboration USA and vice-president of Gotham Government Relations. His focus in Healthcare law is about food, drugs, nutraceuticals, and complementary medicine. He seeks to improve incentive structures around food, medicine and healthcare policy.

Steven Horvitz

D.O

Steven earned his Doctorate of Osteopathy, completed his practice of Family Osteopathy in 1994 and has been in solo private family practice since 1998. In 2008 he established the Institute for Medical Wellness, a direct to primary care service emphasizing prevention, lifestyle interventions and root cause analyses.

Gabor Erdosi

MSc

Gabor Erdosi has a Master’s in Molecular Biology, extensive experience in biotech industries and founded the highly reputed Lower Insulin Facebook curating discussions about health and metabolism. Gabor is also Nutrita’s podcast co-host called the BreakNutrition show, where he and Raphael have reviewed nutrition science papers.
